channel.title: No Class Def Found *error* here to help!
channel.description:
Ok, I've seen a lot of threads asking this question lately, so I decided to make a thread to answer it!
Sometimes when you try to run a bot or other Java program, you might receive this error: [code]Exception in thread 'main': NoClassDefFoundError: [classfile][/code]
This means that java.exe couldn't find the classfile you specified.
This could be fixed several ways, one of which Sythe described in another thread. I'll repeat that here:
Instead of typing: [code]java [myclass][/code]
type
[code]java -cp . [myclass][/code]
another way of doing this is :
Right click My Computer and select properties (or hit windows + break). Click on the Advanced tab. Click on the Environment Variables button. Find the variable called 'path' and add this onto the end of it:
[code].;[/code]
This should fix your problem.
thanks for your time people!

item.title: No Class Def Found *error* here to help!
item.dc:creator: @roflmaos roflmaos
item.description:
@roflmaos wrote:

Ok, I’ve seen a lot of threads asking this question lately, so I decided to make a thread to answer it!

Sometimes when you try to run a bot or other Java program, you might receive this error:

Exception in thread 'main': NoClassDefFoundError: [classfile]

This means that java.exe couldn’t find the classfile you specified.

This could be fixed several ways, one of which Sythe described in another thread. I’ll repeat that here:

Instead of typing:

java [myclass]

type

java -cp . [myclass]

another way of doing this is :

Right click My Computer and select properties (or hit windows + break).
Click on the Advanced tab.
Click on the Environment Variables button.
Find the variable called ‘path’ and add this onto the end of it:

.;

This should fix your problem.

thanks for your time people!
